answers.answer: Idk what gd stands for sorry first time mom and getting used to the lingo but what I can tell u is that u arent a bad mother so dont feel like u r ruinning anything for your baby or yourself...honestly moms are going through test that we would only get while being preggers so its hard to prepare yourself or the baby for certain things and that isnt your fault at all you cant control your body or what it does and your lil one will be fine I had the worst stomach flu in the beginning and he was a super star and made it through that u would be surprisedwhat babies can pull through dont stress and your doctors will help u make sure u and the baby are healthy gurl just think postive :)

Its so hard tho.. GD is gestational diabetes and a lady that was pregnant had a stillborn because of it.. her baby stopped moving and they made her give birth vaginally since she had GD they could give her a c-section. She had to push knowing her little baby was already gone before she even entered the world... and because of the GD her baby was 12 lbs
There is a lady that just posted on here she was borderline g.diabetic but is doing good thanks to weight loss and eating healthy. You should check out her post for positive reinforcement :)
It's titled "not question but wanted to share"

Omg gurl alot of moms have had this issue u will be fine just because u heard one negative story doesnt mean that that will happen to u...and ya I know one mom whom took the test and failed and she has twins but she is fine and her babies are healthy...dont stress girlie :))
My mom had gd with me and I'm fine :) I also have had friends with it as well! You just have to watch what you intake and it will be ok! They will teach you all about it

I wish I was like that lady.. I wanted the test earlier on in the pregnancy because diabetes in my family history but they wouldn't do it.. I feel like I'm failing my baby.. hopefully I can change things around.. not for loosing weight but for my little girl..

My best friend had GD through her whole pregnancy and acted like it was nothing and she had a healthy 9lb baby girl... Not always is it a bad thing but remember it CAN be controlled by your diet so just make a conscious effort to do the best you can and I'm sure everything will work out for you.

question: I just got a call back from my doctor.. my GD test was too high... I'm going back on monday for the 3-hr test. I feel horrible.. I feel like I am failing my baby girl.. its not fair that I am basically ruining her life in thw future without her even getting a chance. Theres so many things that may develop when sheis older.. I feel like a horrible mother already and I can't stop crying..
title: Feeling like crap....
